p: The antioxidant capacities of L. pubescens EO may be attributed to the high content of the oil's major phenolic constituents, especially carvacrol, which were confirmed as effective antioxidant compounds with potential health benefits [ 40]. Our results demonstrate that the EOs of L. pubescens and carvacrol have a significant strength to provide electrons to reactive oxygen species (ROS), converting them into more stable nonreactive species and ending the free ROS chain reaction.
